cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 175 miles SSE of Nassau, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest through the Bahamas, then turning NNW and tracking very close to Florida’s east coast before lifting northward along the U.S. Atlantic seaboard
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: possible brushing landfall/close coastal pass along Florida’s southeast–east-central coast between Boca Raton and the Volusia/Brevard County line

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hallandale Beach FL northward to Ponte Vedra Beach FL on the Atlantic side
weather_observation.warning_coast: Boca Raton FL to Volusia/Brevard County line on the Atlantic side; northwestern and central Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Atlantic coastline from South Florida through the Carolinas and eventually the Mid-Atlantic and New England
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (forecast generally 1–2 inches on the Gulf side)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No (surge watch confined to Atlantic coast)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible, with peak gusts generally below tropical-storm force (≤35 mph) at the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Tampa’s Gulf coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain with totals around 1–2 inches; locally higher amounts possible in outer rain bands
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough bay/near-shore seas and higher than normal tides could briefly affect small-craft operations
